Key Arguments: The bill is compared to propaganda efforts by totalitarian regimes, suggesting it is a tool for government censorship.
The government is accused of being motivated by greed and self-interest rather than public good.
The bill is seen as a means to censor information that contradicts the government's narrative, even if it is in the public interest.
There is concern that the bill will lead to the suppression of important information, such as COVID-19 origins and vaccine safety.
The legislation is believed to result in reduced public dialogue and a decline in the human condition due to censorship.
Notable Quotes: It's a disgraceful state of affairs that a bill like this should even be proposed in Australia.
It's pretty clear that this bill is intended to enable the government to censor information.
The result of the bill being passed will be the covering up of information that the public has the right to know.
Your grandchildren and great-grandchildren will know of you as monsters, just as people today think of Hitler, Stalin, Goebbels, etc.
